title.narrative: OUTPUT 9: COMMUNICATION FOR DEVELOPMENT

description.narrative: By 2022, community structures are engaged to use evidence, communication tools and packages to promote the adoption of key family- care practices, uptake of available social services for children, adolescents and women, including in emergency., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change (Covid), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Effectively plan, monitor, evaluate and report on programme delivery.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, community structures are engaged to use evidence, communication tools and packages to promote the adoption of key family- care practices, uptake of available social services for children, adolescents and women, including in emergency.

description.narrative: UNICEF supported systems strengthening for C4D by strengthening RCCE coordination and expanding these to non-COVID priorities; supporting development and implementation of C4D strategies for the LHW programme, child protection, ECD and immunization; and strengthening evidence-generation for behaviour change in WASH and ECD. Targeted C4D helped reduce COVID-19 vaccine refusals, enhance adherence to COVID protocols and contributed to measles-rubella introduction exceeding its targets.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:10/01/2022
